name: Vereniging van Effectenbezitters VEB
goal:
The Dutch Investorsâ€™ Association VEB, also known under its name European Investors, is an independent organisation since 1924. The VEB / European Investors is an active organisation with a broad-based membership which defends the interests of retail and institutional investors in the public debate, but also in connection with financial product providers, listed companies and supervising authorities. The VEB / European Investors also is the most important source of independent information on investments in Europe.

The VEB / European Investors unite European investors with the objective of achieving an optimum return by representing their interests, combining strengths, providing and exchanging information, promoting honest and efficient financial markets and initiating collective actions for redress.
interests: Banking and financial services, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Competition, Consumers, Economy, finance and the euro, Employment and Social Affairs, Environment, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Taxation
euInitiatives:
Financial Markets regulation
Capital Markets Union (CMU)
Consumer Financial Services Action Plan
Prospectus review
Shareholders' Rights Directive II
Investment funds (PRIIPs, UCITS, AIFMD, EuVECA)
Transparency Directive
Market Abuse Directive/Regulation
Audit Reform/Accounting Directive
Corporate Governance
Collective redress
